title: American_Top_40_1979_September_15th
description:
THIS IS THE LAST THREE HOURS OF A FOUR HOUR BROADCAST. THE FIRST HOUR IS MISSING.

Numbers 40-33 were not broadcast.

American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This is a recording of a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this broadcast:

There is a song that was written in five minutes without ever putting pen to paper.
	
Casey tells the story of the millionaire grocery store executive who got into the music business and made a million dollars.

A listener wants to know, "What song took the fewest weeks to reach the number one spot?"

In 1979, a hit album cost about $100,000 to produce, but the number one song in this countdown comes from an album that the penny-pinching producer only spent $20,000 to get it out.
